description.narrative:
This project is a 1 year initiative that will be implemented by Agency For Community Empowerment. This is to support the ongoing work under the the Irish Aid funded project. The project will cover the entire coffee value chain and systematically tackling the challenges facing small holder coffee farmers in West Nile. The key objectives the project seeks to address are to; Strengthen coffeefarmer organizations for effective and collective coffee businesses, Set up the basics for farmers to improve their coffee quality, quantity, Support farmer organizations market their coffee for the best possible price, Empower women farmers in their path to full participation in coffee, as farmers, owners and leaders
AFCE under this project will support farmersto acquire skills on DisasterRisk Reduction, doing market research and availing farmers with market information, establishment of coffee nursery beds as an alternative source of income for the coffee farmers and finally conducting community dialogues to influence women land rights. All this will be done to ensure that women coffee farmers are economically empowered and have sustained livelihoods.

participating-org.narrative:
We are a youth-led organization that was founded in 2011 by a group of professional youths working to improve the livelihoods of vulnerable people by empowering them to utilize their full potential towards holistic development. The organization seeks tocontributeto creation of decent work for young people by promoting positive attitude towards work, provide life skills, conduct trainings anddevelop linkages for interdependence and development.
With support from different partners, the organisationhas extended support to more than 3,000 households both in West Nile and Lango Sub regions. The organization changed its legal status from a CBO to an NGOregistered with NGO Board with registration No. 11485 in 2015. At initiation, the organisation originally was formed by majority male members only, but later on incorporated and prioritized gender into its programming and hence a gender policy was developed and female staff and board members were brought on board.
Vision statement: A value-driven community consciously working for continued improvement of their livelihoods and environment. Goal: A holistically sustained organization contributing to improved livelihoods inWest Nile Sub-region 1. ACHIEVEMENTS What have been the principal results in the past three years that contribute to significant, structural, sustained and positive improvement in the lives of men, women, girls and boys suffering from poverty, injustice, insecurity and exclusion? With funding from Self Help Africa, The Organisation Successfully promoted apiary value chain among 1500 farmers in Nebbi and Kole districts of northern Uganda. Traditionally apiculture (Apiary) is predominantly a male dominated enterprise that never included women, but with the intervention at least thenumber of women increased from 5% to 45% and hence led to increased income and improved standard of living of the women. Promoted standard sanitary Pads among adolescent girls in Nebbi Municipality for improved hygiene and livelihood that resulted into increased income, knowledge and skills among the adolescent girls, their self-esteembuilt with practical knowledge and skills, life skills trainings to mention. The support came from European Union through International Labour Organization (ILO) AFCE inpartnership with Twin and Twin Trading Company Limited with funding from Oxfam participated in the implemented of West Nile farmers and their coffee pilot project which saw increased participation and ownership of women in the coffee production whichculturally is male crop. Women participation increased, the quality of coffee improved, farmers were also exposed to the international market. The project benefited over 300 households in both Nebbi and Zombo district. 3. INSTITUTIONALPURPOSE Mission:What is the current purpose of the organisation? Mission Statement: We strive for better Local resources management, community empowerment, and livelihood improvement using advocacy, networking and skills development as an entry point.
Institutional objectives: What are the principal changes the organisation seeks to achieve over the long term? Objectives: # To form a platform for advocacy where all community concerns can be channeled to trigger action. # To build the capacity of the community and other stakeholders through advisory, training, skills development and consultancy. # To harness the skills, attitudes and knowledge of theeducated unemployed through promotion of vocational skills, experience sharing, exposures and opportunities for internships and jobs. # To improve community livelihoods through promotion of sustainable agricultural practices and good environment management. # To improve community hygiene and sanitation

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
